fr.sorbonne_u.cps.caching.interfaces

Interface ComputableCI<A,V>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, ComputableFI<A,V>, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ComputableAllCI<A,V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputableAllConnector, ComputableAllInboundPort, ComputableAllOutboundPort, ComputableConnector, ComputableInboundPort, ComputableOutboundPort

    public interface ComputableCI<A,V>
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI, ComputableFI<A,V>
    The component interface ComputableCI declares the signature under which the computation service can be called.

    Description

    This example is taken and adapted from the following book:

    B. Goetz et al., Java Concurrency in Practice, Addison-Wesley (Pearson Education), 2006.

    Nota: since Java 8, Oracle jdk release 241, methods inherited by a remote interface are no longer considered remote if the inherited interface is not itself remote; to bypass this, methods must be redefined in the remote method. Marking them with @Override stresses the design objective to share identical signatures between the implementation interface and the component interface.

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2020-03-10

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      V compute(A arg)
      compute over the argument and return the result.
